newsitem.title: INDIA: Voltas in tie-up with Hyundai unit.
newsitem.headline: Voltas in tie-up with Hyundai unit.

text.p: Indian engineering firm Voltas Ltd. said on Friday it had entered into an agreement with Korean firm Hyundai Heavy Industries Ltd, to market its construction equipment in India.
"The Hyundai Heavy Industries Ltd. have entered into the booming Indian construction equipment market through Voltas Ltd's Mining and Construction Equipment Division," Voltas said in a statement.
"An exclusive distribution agreement between the two companies was signed during the third week of July 1997," the statement added.
Voltas said it would market Hyundai's hydraulic excavators, wheel loaders, skid steer loaders and allied equipment and attachments in India.
"In continuation to the government's economic reforms and liberalisation policy, the future business potential for Hyundai and Voltas is tremendous," it added.
Voltas is part of India's largest business group, the Tatas. Hyundai Heavy Industries Ltd. is part of the $1-billion Korean international conglomerate, Hyundai.
